intro: Arrabidaea rhodantha f. mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaved rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, showy pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically soft and hairy, giving it a distinct appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
